availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Martin (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, student and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Nimrod Martin and Elizabeth Martin. Married to Mary Coit Martin in Woodford County on August 9, 1859. Student in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 434B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 825.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 491B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320, p. 263 of 279 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com)
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Woodford County, KY, September 1863, p. 226 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "William T. Martin (1833-1869)," Memorial #196947144, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/196947144 (accessed January 28, 2021).
